page.title: 19RECREATION IN ASTON-J-M
page.content: {The leisure activities of the children divide into 2 groups;those centred on school and those on home or community. Few of the children stay for after school activities because of the timing of the school bus.{Watching {television}is the most popular pastime for children but there is a wide variety of other pursuits;e.g.horse- riding,swimming,computer games,music, fishing & reading.{Membership of clubs {or societies}is rare.{Adult pastimes follow a similar pattern,with T.V. the most popular.Other activities include gardening,walking,swimming,keep-fit, whist,reading & darts. Membership of clubs & societies is again rare, but the two organisations most often subscribed to are{Worleston Women's {Institute and Nantwich Young Farmers' {Club.
